title: How to Cook Noodles Without Readymade Soup Mix

steps.headline: Bring a cup of water to a boil.
Meanwhile, chop up a small onion and add to the water.
Add half a teaspoon of turmeric powder and half a teaspoon of red chilli powder (alternatively, you can add a green chilli, thinly sliced).
Add one-two tablespoons of tomato paste (alternatively, chop up a small tomato).
steps.description: The tomato will give your noodles the delicious orange colour as well as taste.

steps.headline: Add salt to taste (half to one teaspoon).
Wash and add frozen vegetables, such as peas, carrots, corn, celery, potatoes and beans.
Beat the noodles with a spatula or break with your hands.
steps.description: Some people prefer longer noodles and should beat less, whereas those who prefer shorter noodles should beat more.

steps.headline: Add the noodles to the boiling water for about five minutes.
When the noodles are tender to your liking, you can add your favourite sauce (such as garlic chilli sauce) to the noodles for extra spice.
You can have soupy noodles as they are, or drain the water a little.
Serve noodles in a bowl (as heat will dissipate faster from a plate).

text: Bring a cup of water to a boil.  Meanwhile, chop up a small onion and add to the water.  Add half a teaspoon of turmeric powder and half a teaspoon of red chilli powder (alternatively, you can add a green chilli, thinly sliced).  Add one-two tablespoons of tomato paste (alternatively, chop up a small tomato). The tomato will give your noodles the delicious orange colour as well as taste. Add salt to taste (half to one teaspoon).  Wash and add frozen vegetables, such as peas, carrots, corn, celery, potatoes and beans.  Beat the noodles with a spatula or break with your hands. Some people prefer longer noodles and should beat less, whereas those who prefer shorter noodles should beat more. Add the noodles to the boiling water for about five minutes.  When the noodles are tender to your liking, you can add your favourite sauce (such as garlic chilli sauce) to the noodles for extra spice.  You can have soupy noodles as they are, or drain the water a little.  Serve noodles in a bowl (as heat will dissipate faster from a plate). Enjoy!
